result.execSummary:
The defendant Susan L. LUGIAI was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Battery - No contest plea to the amended charge.   Convicted.   Defendant is sentenced to the Manitowoc County Jail for twenty-seven (27) days, under the Huber Law, to commence on 12-20-16 at 6:00 p.m.   
$443.00 court costs imposed, to be paid by 03-09-17 or 8 days jail.   $50.00 cash bail applied.   
Submit DNA sample.   
Minutes.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 2, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

The State filed an Amended Information, amending the charge to Misdemeanor Battery, contrary to sec. 940.19(1) of the Wisconsin State Statutes.
Atty. Pozorski states his client is having a possible medical issue at this time, and requests an adjournment.
Plea/Sentencing hearing is set for 08-30-2016 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 2.
Amended Information amending the charge to Misdemeanor Battery, contrary to sec. 940.19(1) of the Wisconsin State Statutes.

Joseph Pozorski III, through Public Defender.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 09-02-15 at 1:30 p.m.     
Minutes.
RE:  David Neuser, on 08-13-15.
At 3:22 p.m., $50.00 cash bail furnished and the defendant is released from custody.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of substantial batteryd-dvo.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 08-24-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $50.00 cash with the conditions that she have no contact with David Neuser and maintain absolute sobriety.
